page.title: 10Old buildings and houses
page.content: This area does not have a good supply of bulding materials.The nearest stone quarries are 17 km. away and so only prestige buildings, such as Hordley's church, were stone until the canal was built. Afterwards even barns and farm walls were made of stone. An attractive local building method is to construct a timber frame and to fill in with bricks. Several examples of this can be found on Tetchill Moor. In Hordley one has been extended using concrete as well as bricks and timber but, from the outside it is difficult to distinguish new from original. A similar restoration project has gone on in Tetchill. Some quite old buildings in Hordley, such as the old Tythe Barn, are built completely of bricks, although the bricks are smaller than present day ones.
